main.name: Kevin Yao
main.occupation: Goldwater Scholar, Davidson Fellow, and TAMU Brown Scholar pursuing Computer Engineering
main.description: I am dedicated to researching and developing machine learning and software solutions to global healthcare issues
main.bio: I am programmer, researcher, physicist, and aspiring physician. The type to spend his summer days taking classes and evenings self-learning quantum mechanics and deep learning. To be early-assurance accepted to medical school while majoring in computer engineering. To work in three research labs involving investigating next-generation two-dimensional nanomaterials, developing a mobile application based on Unity, Django, and convolutional neural networks to predict stroke, and developing my own pytorch models for prediction of cancer prognosis. And to be recognized with the Goldwater Scholarship, the most prestigious undergraduate research scholarship, and the Davidson Fellowship, a $10,000 scholarship given to the top 20 researchers in the world under the age of 18. Get ready to redefine your definition of hard-working.
main.contactmessage: Please contact me using the below form, or by email or phone if you have any questions.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
